author: Peter Nicholas
description: Trump is ready to ditch the old 747 known as Air Force One in favor of a luxe jet that the royal family of Qatar wants to gift to the U.S.
title: While pushing ‘America First,’ Trump set to accept Qatar’s luxury jet as Air Force One

author: Phil Helsel
description: Three climbers died in Washington state when an anchor apparently failed as they were descending in a steep gulley Sunday, the Okanogan County Sheriff’s Office said.
title: 3 climbers die in fall in Washington state

author: Angela Yang
description: Popular kids’ content creator Rachel Griffin Accurso, known as Ms.
title: Ms. Rachel doubles down support for  children in Gaza

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Dallas Mavericks win the NBA Draft lottery for chance to select Duke star Cooper Flagg
title: NBA Draft lottery: Mavericks win No. 1 pick, chance to take Duke star Cooper Flagg

author: Ben Kamisar
description: The move, which won't be official unless the full DNC approves it, could open up new races for the positions held by Hogg, a Florida activist, and Malcolm Kenyatta, a Pennsylvania state legislator.
title: DNC panel recommends redo of vote that elevated David Hogg to vice chair after procedural concerns

author: The Politics Desk
description: A drug pricing executive order points to a unique tendency for Trump in his second term: a reluctance to attempt bipartisanship, even when there is significant overlap with Democrats on a goal.
title: Trump's drug pricing move shows his second-term reluctance to try bipartisanship: From the Politics Desk

author: Bridget Bowman
description: Newark Mayor Ras Baraka’s arrest last week at a federal immigration detention facility could shake up the New Jersey governor’s race, as Baraka looks to appeal to progressive Democratic voters to win the crowded primary.
title: Newark Mayor Ras Baraka's arrest could shake up New Jersey's Democratic primary for governor

author: Duncan Gardham
description: A Russian spy ring plotted to trade blood diamonds for weapons in Africa and, supply drones to Russia’s military, according to messages shown to a London court.
title: Honeytraps and high tech: Russian spy ring members jailed in the U.K.

author: Kaitlyn Schwanemann
description: Fifty years ago, at the age of 12, Huy Nguyen fled Saigon with his family as a refugee.
title: Family who fled Saigon went from being on welfare to three generations of medical professionals

author: Abigail Williams
description: American officials welcomed a group of 59 Afrikaners, who are from the white ethnic minority who ruled South Africa during apartheid, to the U.S. as refugees.
title: White South Africans arrive in the U.S. as refugees, protected under Trump's carve out

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Rapper Tory Lanez, who is serving a 10-year prison sentence after he was found guilty of shooting rapper Megan Thee Stallion, was stabbed in prison and rushed to a hospital Monday, officials said.
title: Tory Lanez stabbed in prison and hospitalized

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: The 20-year-old son of a sheriff's deputy is accused of opening fire on the university's main campus in Tallahassee near the student union late Thursday morning, killing two people and injuring at least six, officials said. Officers were eventually able to neutralize and apprehend him.
title: FSU shooting suspect charged with murder

author: Viola Flowers
description: Country singer Morgan Wallen has addressed his controversial "Saturday Night Live" exit, saying he was simply "ready to go home."
title: Morgan Wallen on his controversial 'SNL' exit: 'I was just ready to go home'

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: McDonald’s announced a plan to hire 375,000 employees across the U.S. this summer.
title: McDonald's announces plan to hire 375,000 employees this summer

author: Erik Ortiz
description: The jurors in the federal sex trafficking trial represent a diverse swath of the New York City area and include an investment analyst, a physician assistant and a deli clerk.
title: What to know about the 12 jurors who will decide Diddy's fate

author: Scott Wong
description: House Republicans unveiled the legislative text of their sweeping tax proposal for the massive bill for President Donald Trump's agenda.
title: House Republicans unveil sweeping tax plan but have yet to resolve key fight over SALT

author: Annika Kim Constantino, CNBC
description: As struggling drugstore chains work to regain their footing, Walgreens is doubling down on automation.
title: Walgreens doubles down on prescription-filling robots to cut costs, free up pharmacists amid turnaround

author: Lillian Rizzo, CNBC
description: Fox Corp. will launch its direct-to-consumer streaming service, to be called Fox One, ahead of the National Football League season later this year.
title: Fox streaming service to be called Fox One, launch before NFL season

author: Pia Singh, CNBC
description: U.S. President Donald Trump could have the upper hand in subsequent trade talks with China as the nations hammer out further negotiations, according to Neo Wang, lead China economist and strategist at Evercore ISI.
title: Expect China to help Trump on fentanyl, TikTok and midterm elections, says Evercore ISI strategist

author: Chris DiLella, CNBC
description: A legendary timepiece is about to step into the spotlight.
title: A rare platinum Rolex is heading to auction and could fetch $1.7 million

description: Opening statements are underway in the federal sex trafficking trial of rap mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs. A string of high profile witnesses are expected to offer testimony in the coming days.
title: Opening statements underway in Sean 'Diddy' Combs sex trafficking trial

author: The Associated Press
description: Jupiter’s dazzling auroras are hundreds of times brighter than those seen on Earth, new images reveal.
title: NASA’s Webb Space Telescope captures bright auroras on Jupiter

author: Michael Wayland, CNBC
description: DETROIT — General Motors has hired Sterling Anderson, a former Tesla executive and cofounder of autonomous vehicle company Aurora Innovation, as its chief product officer.
title: GM hires ex-Tesla, Aurora exec as chief product officer

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: The NBA will hold its annual draft lottery Monday night, revealing which team will have the No. 1 pick in June’s draft and a chance to draft Cooper Flagg.
title: NBA Draft lottery: Who has the best chance for the No. 1 pick?

author: Nidhi Sharma
description: Researchers were told not to share data on the January fires or to update a climate disaster database before the Trump administration shut the  program down.
title: How much damage did the L.A. wildfires cause? After federal cuts, a crucial estimate is missing

author: Denise Chow
description: An early-season heat wave is set to bake huge swaths of the country this week, with record or near-record high temperatures expected across the Plains, the Southwest and much of central and southern Texas.
title: An early-season heat wave will bring record temperatures to the Southwest and Texas

author: The Associated Press
description: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti will leave the Spanish club and take over as coach of Brazil’s national team, the Brazilian soccer federation said Monday.
title: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti will leave the club to take over Brazil national team

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Six-time NBA champion Michael Jordan will join NBC Sports’ coverage as a special contributor this fall, it was announced Monday.
title: Michael Jordan to join NBC Sports NBA coverage as special contributor

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A Nebraska family is calling for more accessible mental health care after a husband, wife and their children were found dead from what authorities say is an apparent murder-suicide.
title: Nebraska family of 4 killed in apparent murder-suicide, police say

author: The Associated Press
description: About half of U.S. adults approve of how President Donald Trump is handling transgender issues, according to a new poll — a relative high point for a president who has the approval overall of about 4 in 10 Americans.
title: Transgender issues are a strength for Trump, new poll finds

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: The Trump plan won't be limited to Medicare prescriptions and will also target medications covered by Medicaid and private insurance.
title: Trump signs executive order that aims to slash drug prices by at least 50%

author: J.J. McCorvey
description: Top-ranking Democrats are pressing Pepsi for information on its pricing, renewing pressure on a major consumer brand as inflation concerns persist under the new Republican administration.
title: Democrats push Pepsi to prove it doesn't offer sweetheart pricing to big retailers

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Travel woes persisted Monday at beleaguered Newark Liberty International Airport Airport in New Jersey with a ground delay in effect.
title: Newark Airport woes persist with ground delay and more than 80 cancellations

author: Rob Wile
description: Stocks rocketed higher Monday morning after the U.S. and China announced an agreement to reduce their reciprocal tariffs, offering a sense of relief for investors who'd feared a significant economic downturn from President Donald Trump's trade policies.
title: Dow adds 1,000 points, S&P 500 up 3% after the U.S. and China slash tariffs

description: Watch live coverage as President Donald Trump signs an executive order that aims to lower the costs of prescription drugs and holds a news conference with Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: Trump holds a news conference on lowering prescription drug prices

author: Patrick Smith
description: People may come back to the church in part because it now has an American-born leader, Pope Leo XIV told NBC News' Lester Holt at the Vatican on Monday.
title: Pope Leo suggests people may return to the church because of an American pope

description: The federal criminal trial of Sean “Diddy” Combs is officially underway with Combs' legal team and New York prosecutors set to give opening statements after they finalize the jury. The case centers around four main accusers including Combs’ former girlfriend Cassie Ventura who could testify as early as Monday. NBC’s Chloe Melas reports for TODAY.
title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs trial set to begin: Who’s expected to testify?

author: Greg Rosenstein
description: The first game of the 2025 NFL season will be held in Philadelphia on Thursday, Sept. 4 as the defending Super Bowl champion Eagles will host the Dallas Cowboys on NBC.
title: Eagles vs. Cowboys on NBC will open 2025 NFL season

description: The U.S.-China agreement doesn't include tariffs on cars, steel, aluminum and more, President Trump said.
title: U.S.-China trade war eases after both sides agree to reduce tariffs

author: Reuters
description: Ukrainian authorities said Russian attacks against Ukraine continued on Monday, despite a ceasefire proposed by Europe and Ukraine that Russia did not agree to abide by.
title: Ukraine says Russian attacks continued after ceasefire proposed by Europe kicked in

description: NBC’s Lester Holt joins TODAY to share his conversation with Pope Leo XIV on the importance of being the first American pontiff and whether he plans to head home to the United States soon.
title: Pope Leo XIV talks to NBC News: What he told Lester Holt

author: Reuters
description: The Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) militant group, which has been locked in bloody conflict with the Turkish state for more than four decades, decided to disband and end its armed struggle, a news agency close to the group reported Monday.
title: Kurdish PKK disbands and ends Turkey insurgency, PKK-linked agency says

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: The U.S. and China agree to a 90-day pause on most tariffs.
title: U.S. and China agree to pause most tariffs and Hamas to release Edan Alexander: Morning Rundown

author: Sawdah Bhaimiya, CNBC
description: U.S. Treasury yields moved higher on Monday after the U.S. and China agreed to slash tariffs on each other’s goods, in a move welcomed by investors.
title: Investors signal their relief at U.S.-China tariff reduction

author: Arjun Kharpal, CNBC
description: Global technology and chip stocks rallied on Monday after the U.S. and China agreed to pause most tariffs on each other’s goods.
title: U.S.-China breakthrough sends tech and chip stocks soaring

author: Mike Hixenbaugh
description: Joe Campbell says his calling is to share God’s love, but a group of women say he sexually abused them as girls. An NBC News investigation uncovered decades of missed warnings and failures to act.
title: A preacher’s dark secret: Sleepovers, porn and sex abuse allegations dating back decades

author: Daniel Arkin
description: When opening statements start Monday in Sean "Diddy" Combs’ federal sex trafficking trial, lawyers will portray the music mogul in dramatically contrasting terms.
title: Attorneys in Sean Combs' case set to present dueling narratives in trial openings

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: CHICAGO — As the first pope from the United States and a dual citizen of America and Peru, Pope Leo XIV — a native of the Windy City — is emerging as a symbol of hope for those seeking a more compassionate approach to immigration, standing in sharp contrast to President Donald Trump’s divisive policies.
title: Can Pope Leo XIV influence the nation's immigration debate?

author: Courtney Kube
description: The Trump administration spent at least $21 million transporting migrants to Guantanamo Bay on military aircraft between January 20 and April 8, according to figures provided to Congress by the U.S. military.
title: Pentagon spent at least $21 million on flights to Guantanamo, which currently holds 32 migrants

author: The Associated Press
description: Each year on April 18, the anniversary of the 1983 bombing at the U.S. Embassy in Beirut that took the lives of her father and 62 others, a persistent sense of loss awakens in Cathy.
title: USAID is all but gone. For one family, 3 generations of service were defined by it

author: The Associated Press
description: Residents jumped from a four-story apartment building in Milwaukee during a Mother’s Day fire that killed four people and critically injured four others.
title: Residents jump from windows during Milwaukee apartment fire that kills 4

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: Hamas said that it will release Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander, who is believed to be the last living U.S. citizen held captive in Gaza.
title: Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander to be released Monday, Hamas says

author: The Associated Press
description: The Trump administration has fired the nation’s top copyright official, Shira Perlmutter, days after abruptly terminating the head of the Library of Congress, which oversees the U.S.
title: Trump administration fires top copyright official days after firing Librarian of Congress

author: David Rohde
description: Legal experts and Democrats expressed growing alarm over the weekend that Trump administration officials are openly discussing unilaterally suspending habeas corpus — a bedrock American legal right — without the approval of Congress.
title: Trump admin's threat to suspend core U.S. legal right sparks outcry and alarm

author: Becca Wood, TODAY
description: Amber Heard is a now a mother of three.
title: Amber Heard shares she has welcomed twins in surprise Mother’s Day announcement

author: Maddie Ellis, TODAY
description: Jordon Hudson, girlfriend of former NFL football coach Bill Belichick, placed second runner-up in the Miss Maine USA pageant over the weekend.
title: Jordon Hudson places second runner-up in Miss Maine USA pageant with Bill Belichick in front row

author: Hayden Mitman, NBC Philadelphia
description: The bodies of two people were removed from the scattered debris after after neighbors say a New Jersey home exploded early Sunday.
title: 2 bodies found in New Jersey home that neighbors say exploded

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: Sabu, a "hardcore" professional wresting legend whose real name was Terry Brunk, has died at 60 years old, WWE announced Sunday.
title: Sabu, legend of pro wrestling's 'hardcore' style, dies at 60
